text: 'Cangjie programming language_generics_constraints_generic_constraint_types': 'In Cangjie code language, Constraints are broadly divided into interface constraints and subtype constraints. The syntax is to use the where keyword before the declaration body of a function or type to declare, for the declared generic parameters T1, T2, you can use where T1 <: Interface, T2 <: Type to declare generic constraints, and multiple constraints of the same type variant can use & join. For example: where T1 <: Interface1 & Interface2.'
